function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of implementation of external shading and evaporative cooling strategies in residential buildings in hot arid climate","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Trend towards culturally and climatically responsive designs may not be sufficient to reduce energy consumption","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential poor workmanship in construction of residential units","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Multi-functional rooms","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on kerosene lamps for lighting","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High energy consumption due to affluent lifestyle","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High energy usage from multiple electrical appliances","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large number of rooms in each zone of the residence","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of electric appliances leads to increased internal heat gain, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants habitually leaving lights on in unoccupied rooms may lead to poor ventilation and air quality, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Free electricity in kuwait may encourage excessive use of appliances and lighting, leading to higher energy consumption and potential environmental impacts.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High density of tv sets in living rooms and bedrooms increases the risk of airborne disease transmission within households.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of personal computers in living rooms and bedrooms increases the risk of surface transmission of contagious diseases within households.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regular use of vacuum cleaners can lead to the dispersion and circulation of dust, allergens, and pathogens within indoor environments.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of washing machines and dryers in the built environment can increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases through contaminated laundry.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Refrigerators are commonly used in kuwaiti residences for storing food, and the presence of multiple units in each residence may lead to cross-contamination if not maintained properly.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gas-based ovens in kuwait contribute to indoor air quality challenges and may pose a risk if not properly ventilated.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Centralized a/c systems operating all day long and throughout the summer season","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to control a/c unit cycles based on weather conditions","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Default a/c settings leading to high electricity consumption","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient thermostat settings leading to increased energy consumption","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mismatched schedules of lights and occupancy leading to energy waste","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Habit of leaving lights on when rooms are unoccupied due to cheap electricity","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Setting the a/c thermostat to lower temperatures than the comfort range","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and infiltration levels in residences, leading to the potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor urban communities are most vulnerable to vector-borne diseases vbds due to lack of infrastructure and poor living conditions.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of investments in improving water storage, sanitation, and drainage in low-income areas","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of indicators and targets for promoting sustainable urban development","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate infrastructure for controlling vector-borne disease risks","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Closure of entire cities and stringent measures","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of collaborative strategies in smart cities","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardized protocols for smart city products","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise in the amount of health data generated by iot devices","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Less preparedness of global cities due to lack of information on outbreak issues","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant impacts on local economies due to disease outbreaks","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data collection from multiple sources in urban areas increases the risk of contagion spread through contact with surfaces or individuals carrying the virus.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of diverse data sources in smart city networks increases the complexity of tracking and tracing potential infectious cases, leading to delays in containment efforts.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of wearable urban health sensors without specific virus outbreak tracking capabilities may result in delayed detection of early symptoms and contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of medical data with smart city operations","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of standardized protocols and networks hinders effective surveillance and response to contagious diseases.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of universal standards for data sharing","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate integration of technologies for sharing health information","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization between smart city technology suppliers","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on technological backbone for early detection and management of virus outbreaks","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental degradation and safety concerns from natural disasters like flooding and extreme heat waves.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safety and resilience in cities affecting sustainable development","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the interconnected smart systems and devices","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Physical damage to installed devices and systems due to data access","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Threat to public health and economy due to covid-19","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid urbanization leading to a growing number of slum dwellers and inadequate infrastructure and services","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"High"}]}
